item.description:
In December we're celebrating the holidays with a fondue night book discussion! We'll get festive as we enjoy Chaibo's famous Chocolate Fondue while discussing Holidays on Ice by David Sedaris.

Below is a description of Chaibo's chocolate fondue, from their website, along with a description of the book by an Amazon reviewer (the book is short and light for easy and fun holiday reading!).

What to expect with a
Chaibo Fondue Creation:

You will be presented with a Fondue Pot containing an ample amount of warm melted chocolate. The chocolate is ready and waiting for you to gently dip (or if you prefer to ram in and smother) the following delectable treats:

Strawberries • Banana Chunks • Marshmallows Brownies • Cheesecake • Rice Krispy Treats

YUM!

 

Holidays on Ice by David Sedaris

David Sedaris's beloved holiday collection is new again with six more pieces, including a never before published story. Along with such favorites as the diaries of a Macy's elf and the annals of two very competitive families, are Sedaris's tales of tardy trick-or-treaters ("Us and Them"); the difficulties of explaining the Easter Bunny to the French ("Jesus Shaves"); what to do when you've been locked out in a snowstorm ("Let It Snow"); the puzzling Christmas traditions of other nations ("Six to Eight Black Men"); what Halloween at the medical examiner's looks like ("The Monster Mash"); and a barnyard secret Santa scheme gone awry ("Cow and Turkey").

No matter what your favorite holiday, you won't want to miss celebrating it with the author who has been called "one of the funniest writers alive" (Economist).
item.how_to_find_us: We'll be sitting at the first set of comfy couches by the door. See you there!
